sent_inference: I enjoy going sailing with my father.
I don't like eating out at upscale places.
Two of the weekends were sunny.
Some of the movies were funny.
The student was tired or hungry.
sent_context: John and Bob were talking about sailing yesterday.
John and Bob were talking about restaurants yesterday.
Bob and John were talking about the weather during a recent trip.
Yesterday, John and Bob were talking about the movies at a local theater.
Last month, Bob and John were talking about a shirt their friend wore to a party.
Last week, John and Bob were talking about a player in a recent football game.
A year ago, Bob and John were talking about a particular student they used to teach.
A few days ago, John and Bob were talking about cookies at a local bakery.
expt_aim: To see how one interprets meanings of sentences.
sent_question: he enjoys walking in the woods alone?
two but not three of the weekends were sunny?
not all of the movies were funny?
he did not love the shirt?
the student was not both tired and hungry?
the cookies were not always chocolate?
